config.question: What was the primary significance of the battle of Midway?

choices.content: The Americans stopped a Japanese advance toward Australia.
It granted Americans control of the Central Pacific.
The Japanese navy destroyed what was left of the American Pacific fleet.
It prevented the Japanese navy from capturing the Philippines.It prevented the Japanese navy from capturing the Philippines.

answer_3.response: Consider This: The battle of Midway ended with the loss of four Japanese aircraft carriers compared to just one American carrier. This was a major turning point in World War II. See L.O. 27.3 Turning the Tide Against the Axis.
